thread.title: Lady Cougars bounce back in big way, reach second round with sweep
thread.title_full: Lady Cougars bounce back in big way, reach second round with sweep

title: Lady Cougars bounce back in big way, reach second round with sweep
text:
Lady Cougars bounce back in big way, reach second round with sweep by Comments 
Ansley Knight (6) and Anna Marie Campbell (3) leap in attempt to block a Rockdale County return shot while Jenni Young gets ready to defend from the back line during Wednesday’s state playoff match. 
It’s always good to cleanse one’s palate from a disappointing loss, especially when it’s a big one against a close rival. 
But Newnan’s first-round state tournament sweep over Rockdale County on Wednesday at home did more than blur the memories of last Saturday’s Area 3- tournament runner-up finish. 
A 25-12, 24-14, 24-9 effort seemed to reinvigorate confi- dence in a Lady Cougars team that posted its 29th victory of the season and more impor- tantly returned to the Class Sweet 16 for the first time in two years. 
Newnan (29-16), which moved its first-round match up a day with two players participating in today’s homecoming parade, will now travel to Area 7- champion Norcross (31-14) on Tuesday with a chance to reach the GHSA Elite 8. 
Newnan defensive specialist Hallie Goolsby comes up with a dig from the back line during Wednesday’s first-round match at the Max Bass Athletic Center. 
Adding at least the program’s fifth consecutive volleyball patch to its postseason banner at the Max Bass Athletic Complex, Newnan held off a scrappy Rockdale County lineup that was looking to avenge a 2-0 loss to the Lady Cougars from Sept. 12 at the North Cobb Playdate. 
“You could see that they really had improved from the first time we played them this year,” Newnan head coach Krista Wilson said. “We were coming off a tough loss, but these girls are resilient. I thought we hustled, made a lot of plays and dove for a lot of balls.” 
Senior Jenni Young led the Lady Cougars offense with 11 kills, seven of which came in a second set where Newnan closed on an 8-0 run off of a timeout. 
“We tell the girls we want to win the timeout,” Wilson said. “And we did that.” 
Ahead 1-0, back-to-back errors allowed Rockdale County to close within a three-point deficit twice before Wilson called time. On the ensuing point, Ansley Knight came up with a dig that found Young, who quickly set up Callie Bass for a kill and a 18-14 advantage. 
With Bass closing out the game on serve, Newnan picked up three consecutive points from Knight and Crystal Burk, the latter on two plays from the front line before Rockdale took a timeout of its own. By then, though, it was too late to salvage the second set. 
It didn’t stop Rockdale from trying to get back in the match in the final game, which see-sawed through five lead changes and five ties before Bass served 10 consecutive points to help instigate a 14-1 Newnan run. 
Young picked up her final kill for a 23-8 lead and Bass closed it out with Newnan’s final point. 
Five Lady Cougars had kills in game one, including two by Burk and one each from Bass, Knight and Hallie Goolsby. 
Bass finished with five kills while Knight and Burk added four and three, respectively. Olivia Masonheimer provided a spark in the middle set with two kills. More
